begin onTrigger MuRef
MuRef.MoveToFade MuHomeRef
END

scn BDBoulderGremlinScript
int RudePC ; PC was rude to Boxy, so note is changed int DPAdvice ; PC asked DP for advice. Adds map markers. int NextTarget ; Keeps track of hints that projector is next target int Fiber ; PC spotted fiber and can mention it to Andre int BoxyBlock ; gets rid of extra option int CheckProj ; player checked projector int ConnieReveal ; Connie confronted player
int Rant ; Connie went through her long rant int Stolen ; Connie stole back evidence int DPPissed ; 0 = DP hasn't confronted Connie. Script Blocker int ConnieOut ; out tampering with projector int ConnieHome ; Connie went out and returned home (allows night package to function after) int PCDetected ; Connie confronts PC int ConnieDetected ; PC saw Connie fiddle with projector int bEggDone ; MoBurma 23/06/12 - PC has deposited eggs, so Connie will now help int bConDecrypt ; Player knows Connie can help with decryption
int DoOnce
int SetOnce
; ------------------------------------------ MoBurma new Vars 22/06/12 -----------------------------------
; These are for the new version of Objective 10, where we now let the player know who has been talked to or not about the grem. ; 0 = NOT talked to ; 1 = Talked to ; These vars are just set in their respective greminfo dialogue string.
int JackieGremtalk int MarkGremtalk int MindyGremtalk int WhiskersGremtalk int LuciaGremtalk int BoxyGremtalk int SamGremtalk int GigiGremtalk int NickyGremtalk int PeteyGremtalk int DeadpanGremtalk int JackieGremtalk int ConnieGremtalk int JeffGremtalk int DrAndreaGremtalk int IngridGremtalk
int bFibreDone ; PC has found fibre and mentioned it to Andre so we can turn on hint objective
begin GameMode
;MoBurma edit 22nd June for new objective
if (AndreRef.GetDead == 1) && (ConnieRef.GetDead == 1) setstage BDBoulderGremlin 255 endif
if Lucia2Ref.GetDead && GetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 15 == 0 && GetStage BDBoulderGremlin < 10 setstage BDBoulderGremlin 255 ; Lucia died before player could get info endif
if GetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 10 == 0 && JackieRef.GetDead && NickyRef.GetDead && GetStage BDBoulderGremlin < 10 setstage BDBoulderGremlin 255 ; They both died before player could get info. If one survives, PC can check projector. endif
if GetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 25 == 0 if BDBoulderGremlin.Fiber == 1 && ConnieReveal == 0 SetObjectiveDisplayed BDBoulderGremlin 19 1 endif endif
if bFibreDone && getObjectiveDisplayed BDBoulderGremlin 26 == 0 SetObjectiveDisplayed BDBoulderGremlin 26 1 endif
END

scn BDDeadpanHatPCScript
Begin OnAdd Player
if (BDDPanRef.getitemcount BDDeadpanHat > 0) || BDDPanRef.GetDead == 1 BDDPanRef.removeitem BDDeadpanHat 5 endif
if Player.GetHasNote BDDeadpanHatNote == 0 AddNote BDDeadpanHatNote endif
END
Begin OnSell
BDDPanRef.Sayto Player DPanBarkSoldHat EmporiumRef.RemoveItem BDDeadpanHatPC 1 CarolineRef.AddItem BDDeadpanHatPC 1 CarolineRef.EquipItem BDDeadpanHatPC
END

scn BDDomeLogBookScript
; note: if any changes are made, make them to the generic greeting quest, the line where Connie translates book.
;int ReadBook int bDoOnce ;MoBurma 22/06/12 for new codes quest
Begin OnAdd Player
If Player.GetAV Science < 60 ;Aug/10/12 - lowered requirements - KAZ showmessage BDDomeLogBookDecrypt endif
End
Begin GameMode
;MoBurma 22/06/12 - new quest set completed below and new vars set.
if BDBoulderCodesQuest.bHasCodes == 1 ;24/06/12 MoBurma - new override value. Return else
If Player.GetItemCount BDDomeLogBook > 0 && abGuileTalkQ.abReadBook == 0
if bDoOnce == 0 set BDBoulderCodesQuest.bHasLogBook to 1 if AndreREF.bAndreGave == 0 SetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderCodesQuest 10 0 endif setstage BDBoulderCodesQuest 10 If Player.GetAV Science < 60 SetObjectiveDisplayed BDBoulderCodesQuest 15 1 endif set bDoOnce to 1 endif
If BDBoulderEnterDome.CodeHint == 1 If Player.GetAV Science >= 50 && abGuileTalkQ.abReadBook == 0 showmessage BDDomeLogBookDecrypted2 AddNote BDClemNote1 AddNote BDClemNote2 AddNote BDClemNote3 AddNote BDBoulderDomeAccessCodes ShrineActRef.enable ShrineRef.disable 6 set abGuileTalkQ.abReadBook to 1 set BDBoulderCodesQuest.bHasCodes to 1 setstage BDBoulderCodesQuest 100 endif Else If Player.GetAV Science >= 60 && abGuileTalkQ.abReadBook == 0 showmessage BDDomeLogBookDecrypted2 AddNote BDClemNote1 AddNote BDClemNote2 AddNote BDClemNote3 AddNote BDBoulderDomeAccessCodes ShrineActRef.enable ShrineRef.disable 6 set BDBoulderCodesQuest.bHasCodes to 1 setstage BDBoulderCodesQuest 100 set abGuileTalkQ.abReadBook to 1 endif endif
endif endif
End

scn BDConnieEvidenceScript
begin OnAdd Player
ShowMessage BDConnieEvidenceMesg
if ConnieRef.GetDead == 0 ConnieRef.MoveTo GremlinAppearRef ConnieRef.AddScriptPackage BDConnieEvidencePkg endif
SetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 10 0 SetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 15 0 if GetObjectiveDisplayed BDBoulderGremlin 26 SetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 26 1 ;MoBurma 23/06/12 - complete new hint obj endif SetObjectiveCompleted BDBoulderGremlin 25 1 SetObjectiveDisplayed BDBoulderGremlin 30 1 SetStage BDBoulderGremlin 20
End

endif

ESP.ORIGINAL: RE: Did you lose something important?
ESP.TRADUIT: 回复：你丢了什么重要的东西吗？

ESP.ORIGINAL:
RE: Did you lose something important?
Subject: RE: Did you lose something important? Sent: January 6 2077 1:32 PM From: John Smythe To: Jane Dowh
Ah, so the great Dome Project has taken your spouse hostage as well? Sorry to hear that though it's nice to know I'm not the only one in this situation. It's hard for me too not having Grace around as much as I'd like, but business is business I suppose. The Project should be done soon, thank goodness. And not a worry. I know how it is to have to vent.
I'll be right there. Thanks for letting me know about my folders, Jane.
John Smythe Operations Manager IME Bionics – Personnel Division

Wow, I'm so glad for these secure emails! I've been afraid our IT maintenance guy would tell on us if he looked through the server logs. And he didn’t know I know a thing or two about computers. This hidden server directory I hacked should allow us to “chat” and nobody but us will know it! :)
Darling, even though we're only a floor away from each other, it feels like miles. I hope people don't notice the giddy feeling I get when I pass you in the hall!

I wanted to have a talk with you tonight, by the way. I have been doing some thinking lately.

哇哦，我真高兴有这些安全邮件！我一直担心我们的IT维护人员如果查看了服务器日志就会告发我们。而他不知道我对电脑略知一二。我入侵的这个隐藏的服务器目录应该可以让我们聊天，而且除了我们之外没有人知道。:)
亲爱的，虽然我们只隔了一层楼，但感觉像是隔了好几英里。我希望人们不要注意到我在大厅里与你擦肩而过时的那种头晕目眩的感觉！
嘿，我在想今晚我们可以去我们最喜欢的咖啡店，你觉得怎么样？在那里度过一个晚上，享受彼此的陪伴？毕竟，夫妻俩这个周末当然会像往常一样忙碌。为什么我们要待在家里等待呢？
唉...想想看，几个文件夹和取消的晚餐计划让我们的生活发生了交集。我好久没这么开心了，简。

你的， - 约翰

Dearest John, you made me remember what true living is supposed to be like! This past weekend was amazing and I won't forget it for a long time. I haven't felt so needed, wanted and cherished in years. I think you woke up my inner child, even.
Spending the weekend with you was scary, but it made me realize so much about myself. (But in a GOOD way!) I don't think I've ever...opened up with Michael like that before, but you made it so easy. Your Jane

最亲爱的约翰，你让我想起了真正的生活应该是什么样的！过去的这个周末太棒了，我很长时间都不会忘记。多年来，我从未觉得自己如此被需要、被渴望、被珍视,我觉得你甚至唤醒了我内心的童真。
和你一起过周末很可怕，但它让我对自己有了更多的认识。(但这是一种好的方式！)我想我从来没有...以前也没有过像这样对迈克尔敞开心扉，但你让这一切变得如此简单。写这些我都脸红了，但这是事实。但你好像在里面？我的。(不，傻瓜！我不是这个意思，但那部分也很不可思议！< 3)

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Subject: Are we sure what we're doing? Sent: June 10 5:22 PM From: Jane Dowh To: John Smythe
Love, I...needed to ask something because it's been on my mind the past few weeks. Are we sure about what we're doing? I mean, I feel wonderful when I'm with you, be it opening my eyes in the morning wrapped in your arms with the sheet still over us. Or eating breakfast across from you, sharing emails like this - basically all of the time. I haven't felt this loved, (or made love) like this...ever. Not even when Michael and I were first married if that tells you anything.
But sometimes I wonder if we're just doing this as a payback to my husband and your wife? They have basically abandoned both of us for that cursed Dome. I know how hurt and neglected we both feel and we have been here for one another. I want you to know that if it is just that, I'd rather us be open about it than to keep on going as we are. I mean, if it could be more, that's good too. I guess I just don't want this feeling to end.
Oh, I don't know how to word this right, John. I don't want to lose you at all. I just wonder at times if we're just acting out with revenge and spite or is it really passion and true love for one another?
I love you regardless the reply, Jane

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To: Harcort Fenton
Subject: Re – follow up report
Hey boss, I just wanted to follow up as we mentioned. I understand the urgency of this project, but after reviewing out current state of logistics, the time line they want is totally unattainable. I simply cannot produce that much product in the time allowed.
The actual manufacturing isn't the problem. It's the programming and AI that are taking so long. With only two virtual programming labs online many of our units are waiting in storage for their turn in a pod. I've been experimenting with trying to speed up the process, but results have been unacceptable.
Yes, they will function in a near optimal level with the sped up programming, but their higher functions (some of the most important ones) are not going to pass the smell test if these guys are captured by the commies. They simply don't have the emotional capacity of a fully programmed unit. It takes more time to imprint a lifetime of experience (even if it is just made up) into their memory.
Shortcutting the process causes the memories to seem less real to them. Therefore they will easily be discovered as an android, not a real human, and that defeats the entire purpose of the project. I'm working around the clock on it, and I believe I'm close to a breakthrough. I'll keep you posted.
P.S. - We finally have three of the VR labs online, but the fourth is still under construction. Main storage is online, but Secondary Storage remains offline until those pods arrive from RobCo. What is their status?
Richard Mudd Director of Operations Harcort Positronics
ESP.TRADUIT:
致: 哈尔科特·芬顿
主题: 回复：跟进报告
嘿，老板，我只是想跟进我们之前讨论过的问题。我理解这个项目的紧迫性，但在审查了我们目前的物流状况后，他们想要的时间表是完全无法实现的。我根本无法在规定的时间内生产那么多产品。
实际的制造并不是问题，是编程和人工智能需要这么长时间。由于只有两个虚拟编程实验室在线，我们的许多设备都在仓库中等待轮到它们。我一直在实验，试图加快这个过程，但结果令人难以接受。
是的，随着编程的加速，他们将以接近最佳的水平发挥作用，但如果这些人被共产党抓住，他们的更高功能(一些最重要的功能)将无法通过嗅觉测试。他们根本不具备完全编程的单位的情感能力。要将一生的经历(即使是编造的)铭刻在他们的记忆中，需要更多的时间。
缩短这个过程会使记忆对他们来说不那么真实。因此，他们很容易被发现是一个机器人，而不是真正的人类，这就违背了整个项目的目的。我正在夜以继日地工作，我相信我即将取得突破。我会与你保持联络。
PS：我们终于有三个VR实验室上线了，但第四个还在建设中。主存储是在线的，但二级存储仍然是离线的，直到那些吊舱从RobCo到达。他们的状况如何？
- 理查德·穆德 运营总监 哈尔科特正电子

ESP.ORIGINAL:
CONFIDENTIAL – TOP SECRET MAXIMIM SECUTIRY CLEARANCE
Subject: Project S.A.R.G.O.N. From: Harcort Fenton
If you're reading this personal correspondence you have been with me from the beginning. What we began as the new future of robotics has now officially been hijacked by a bunch of government sons-of-bitches.
In the interest of “National Security” they have claimed imminent domain on our facility and all research and production will now officially shift to a military project. Expect new security measures to be in place, and new “guests” to arrive next week.
And in typical government fashion, you know how they love acronym's, the project is oficially known as “Project S.A.R.G.O.N,” their acronym for Strategic Artificial Reconnaissance Ground Operations Network.
They're going to use the product that we build for spy missions and ground troops. I tried to tell them these models are only programmed to cook, clean and walk the family dog, but they insisted they be reprogrammed for combat. So expect new programming software to arrive shortly.
HF
ESP.TRADUIT:
密件 - 最高机密 最高安全许可
主题：项目S.A.R.G.O.N. 来自: 哈尔科特·芬顿
如果你正在阅读这封私人信件，那么你从一开始就和我在一起。我们开始设想的机器人新未来现在正式被一群政府的狗娘养的人劫持了。
为了国家安全？他们要求征用我们的设施，所有的研究和生产现在将正式转移到军事项目。期待新的安全措施和新的客户？下周到达。
按照典型的政府风格(你知道他们多么喜欢缩写)，这个项目的官方名称是S.A.R.G.O.N。这是战略人工侦察地面作战网络的首字母缩写。
他们会使用我们的产品建立间谍任务和地面部队。我试着告诉他们，这些模型只能用来做饭、打扫卫生和遛狗，但他们坚持要把它们重新编程，用于战斗。因此，预计新的编程软件很快就会到来。
- 哈尔科特·芬顿

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Richard Mudd – Personal Journal Entry
They want the impossible. True genius cannot ever be rushed, nor manufactured. It MUST by it's very nature cultivate and grow naturally. I simply cannot force these memory imprints to embed properly in the time given and in the speed with which these specimens must be programmed to meet their schedule.
I've tried eliminating the early childhood programming sequence, but those specimens responded to testing with much less emotion than the others. Curious because most of us never remember our early childhood, but it seems as those memories are still filed away in our brains somehow, and they play a vital role in building the foundation for the rest of our lives, even if we can't remember them.
Maybe that Freud guy was on to something?
ESP.TRADUIT:
理查德·穆德个人日记条目
他们想要的是不可能的。真正的天才是不能仓促完成的，也不能人为制造的。它必须根据它的本性自然地培养和生长。我根本无法强迫这些记忆印记正确地嵌入给定的时间，以这些标本必须被编程以满足它们的时间表的速度。
我试过删除早期儿童编程序列，但这些样本对测试的反应比其他样本少得多。这很奇怪，因为我们大多数人都不记得自己的童年早期，但那些记忆似乎仍然在我们的大脑中存档，即使我们不记得它们，它们在为我们以后的生活奠定基础方面发挥着至关重要的作用。
也许那个弗洛伊德说的是对的？

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Richard Mudd – Personal Journal Entry
Not Freud, but Wells?
No, I can't even be thinking about this. It's lunacy. I've been working too much and had too little rest over the last few months. That's it. Yes, working too much.
And Fenton, the damn high king on his high horse doesn't even appreciate the true genius it takes to program a damn machine to be able to pass as a real human. Hell, he only knows pathways, neural nets and circuits.
The true genius is in the programming. But I just can't do it in the time they allow.
But, what if? Could the memories of a small child be converted into a data stream and be induced directly into a specimen? That would make each specimen unique with a completely different life experience than the next!
This might be exactly what I need. But the child? What about the child?
ESP.TRADUIT:
理查德·穆德个人日记条目
不是弗洛伊德，而是威尔斯？
不，我不能再想这些了，这太疯狂了。过去几个月我工作太多，休息太少。就是这样，是的，工作太多了。
芬顿，那个高高在上的至尊王甚至都不知道如何给一个该死的机器编写程序让它成为一个真正的人类。他只知道通路，神经网络和电路。
真正的天才是编程，但我就是没法在他们允许的时间内完成。
但是，如果呢？一个小孩的记忆能被转换成数据流并直接诱导成一个样本吗？这将使每个标本都独一无二，有着与下一个完全不同的生活经历！
这可能正是我需要的。但是孩子呢？孩子怎么办？

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Richard Mudd – Personal Journal Entry
I keep telling myself it was only one orphan boy. Nobody would miss him. He will be unharmed after it's all said and done. But it didn't happen like that did it? There was no way to know without going through with it was there?
Initial experiments were promising with the host fully integrating the memories into their neural net. Initial testing results nearly identical to fully programmed units. However, over time specimen seemed to begin to lose its memories and revert back to the same behavior as other models.
Transfer of memory was preformed while donor was heavily sedated and unconscious. Donor did not survive the process.
ESP.TRADUIT:
理查德·穆德个人日记条目
我一直告诉自己那只是个孤儿，没有人会想念他的。等一切尘埃落定，他会毫发无伤的。但事实并非如此，对吧？不做就不可能知道，对吧？
最初的实验很有希望让宿主将记忆完全整合到他们的神经网络中。最初的测试结果与完全编程的单元几乎相同，然而，随着时间的推移，标本似乎开始失去记忆，并恢复到与其他模型相同的行为。
记忆转移是在供体处于高度镇静和无意识状态下进行的。捐赠者没能在手术过程中存活下来。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Richard Mudd – Personal Journal Entry
Have I really done it? Transplant a human brain into a machine? No, the basic tech is not that new really. RobCo has been making their Robobrains for years. But that's nothing like this. I think I've finally gone completely mad. Just call me Dr. Moreau from now on.
ESP.TRADUIT:
理查德·穆德个人日记条目
我真的做到了吗？把人脑移植到机器里？不，基本的技术其实并不新鲜，RobCo制造他们的机器脑已经很多年了。但那和这个完全不同，我想我终于彻底疯了，从现在起就叫我莫洛博士吧。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
MEMO TO ALL EMPLOYEES Re: Decontamination Procedure Protocol
The new Decontamination Chamber is online. All employees entering the manufacturing area must be sanitized before entering the facility.
In case of Decontamination or malfunction protective force fields will be activated to prevent entry into facility and all access terminals will be closed and encrypted with emergency lock out codes.
Only supervisors will have the password to unlock terminals.
Richard Mudd Director of Operations Harcort Positronics
ESP.TRADUIT:
给全体员工的备忘录 回复: 净化程序协议
新的净化室已经上线。所有进入生产区域的员工在进入工厂前必须经过消毒。
如果净化故障，防护力场将被激活，以阻止进入设施所有接入终端将被关闭，并使用紧急锁码加密。
只有管理员才有解锁终端的密码。
- 理查德·穆德 运营总监 哈尔科特正电子

ESP.ORIGINAL: Decon Chamber Password
ESP.TRADUIT: 净化室密码

ESP.ORIGINAL: Decontamination Force Field Override Password is S.A.R.G.O.N.
ESP.TRADUIT: 净化立场的重载密码是S.A.R.G.O.N.

ESP.ORIGINAL: Security Door Password
ESP.TRADUIT: 安全门密码

ESP.ORIGINAL: neocortex
ESP.TRADUIT: 大脑皮层

ESP.ORIGINAL: Password Note
ESP.TRADUIT: 密码说明

ESP.ORIGINAL: Password = password
ESP.TRADUIT: 密码是：密码

ESP.ORIGINAL: Customized Cattle Prod
ESP.TRADUIT: 定制赶畜棒

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Dear Supervisor Poulsen,
As requested, I've made some modifications to the cattle prod, in the unlikely event that one of the chimpanzees may break free on a violent rampage. In compliance with safety regulations, this "Chimp Prod" will be completely useless against any species other than a chimpanzee, due to the specific frequency of the electrical current. The process of "zapping" a chimp will be completely harmless. The prod is designed to trigger the electrical impulses within the chimp's brain that governs deep sleep. One unforseen side-effect is the charge cannot be used on the same chimp twice, so be careful not to zap a chimp twice in succession, as this will cause a brain-death. The brain is the most mysterious organ; that's all I can say.
Sincerely,
Phillip Dawnbreaker
ESP.TRADUIT:
亲爱的鲍尔森主管,
按照要求，我对赶畜棒做了一些修改，以防其中一只黑猩猩可能会挣脱出来进行暴力袭击。根据安全规定，由于电流的特定频率，这种"黑猩猩棒"对黑猩猩以外的任何物种都完全无用。对黑猩猩进行"电击"的过程将是完全无害的，该道具旨在触发黑猩猩大脑中控制深度睡眠的电脉冲。一个不可预见的副作用是，电荷不能在同一只黑猩猩身上使用两次，所以要注意不要连续对黑猩猩进行两次电击，因为这将导致脑死亡。大脑是最神秘的器官，这就是我所能说的。
真诚的, - 破晓者菲利普

ESP.ORIGINAL: Urgent Message from Captain Despot!
ESP.TRADUIT: 来自德斯波特上校的紧急信息！

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[Note contains coordinates data, and the following message:]
You don't know what you've gotten yourself into, courier. The Brotherhood cannot be trusted. Your life is in danger. Please, come and meet with me at once. Follow the coordinates to our camp in the Colorado Wastes.
Sincerely, Captain James Despot
ESP.TRADUIT:
[说明包含坐标数据，以及以下消息:]
你不知道自己惹上了什么麻烦，邮差。兄弟会是不可信的，你有生命危险。请马上来见我，沿着坐标找到我们在科罗拉多废土的营地。
真诚的, 詹姆斯·德斯波特上校

ESP.ORIGINAL: Lester's Data Transmission
ESP.TRADUIT: 莱斯特的数据传输

ESP.ORIGINAL: [A transmission from Lester. Contains coordinates data and security decryption software, for The Brain Center.]
ESP.TRADUIT: [莱斯特发来的信息。包含神经研究中心的坐标数据和安全解密软件]

ESP.ORIGINAL: Message from Harold to Android
ESP.TRADUIT: 哈罗德给机器人的信息

ESP.ORIGINAL:
[The holotape contains coordinates data and the following message.]
Listen up, android, there isn't much time. The Brotherhood and the NCR are both approaching the Dome. Likely it is the meddling of that courier you told of. Anyway, time is of the essence now. Seal Sarah into my office. Weld the damn door shut, if you have to! Protect her at all costs! Kill anyone who stands in your way! That is a direct order! Do not disobey me, tin-man!
Good luck,
Harold
ESP.TRADUIT:
[全息磁带包含坐标数据和以下信息。]
听着，机器人，时间不多了。兄弟会和NCR都在接近巨蛋，很可能是你跟我说的那个邮差在多管闲事。无论如何，现在时间紧迫，把萨拉关到我办公室去。有必要的话，把那该死的门焊起来！不惜一切代价保护她！杀了所有挡你路的人！这是直接命令！别违抗我，铁皮人！
祝你好运, - 哈罗德

ESP.ORIGINAL: SAVANT LOG 1
ESP.TRADUIT: 萨万特日志 1

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Finally, a cure to the seltsam syndrome has been found! We can all rejoice! I know you all had your doubts, but just this morning, I received a message from outside the Dome. Turns out civilization does exist, and we did not wake alone and helpless at the mercy of the disease. In the 200 years we have been in deep sleep, a cure has been researched and discovered. We didn't have to lift a finger, it's come to us.
Now they certainly don't look like scientists you and I are used to, but clearly times have changed.
Spikey-hair, goggles and a flamethrower? clearly someone with a background in chemistry. The bearded gentleman with the bloodied auto-axe, well, someone that clearly understands the benefits of vivisection. No animal rights activists here. Thank science.
I am impressed they still wear labcoats, despite torn, hastily put on, with half not fitting. Being the forefront of their civilization, these bright minds still respect the regalia of the past.
Maybe they read a paper of mine.
I know your wishes, even though you've been reluctant to express them, due to respect to Dr. Johnson, ones I share. I feel though he is a relic of an old age, we should embrace this new world with a new vision. Therefore, it is with great reluctance that I suggest myself as new Director of the Dome. We can change this place from being our tomb to the beacon of a new civilization, with us at the crest of the wave!
Dr. Savant
ESP.TRADUIT:
终于，治疗泽尔特扎姆综合症的方法被发现了！我们都可以庆祝了！我知道你们都有疑虑，但就在今天早上，我收到了来自巨蛋外的消息。事实证明，文明确实存在，我们并不是孤独无助地醒来，任由疾病摆布。在我们进入深度睡眠的200年里，人们研究并发现了一种治疗方法。我们一根手指都不用动，它就来找我们了！
现在，他们显然不像你我习惯的科学家了，但很明显时代变了。
刺猬头，护目镜，还有喷火器？显然是有化学背景的人。那个拿着带血的自动斧头的大胡子绅士，他清楚地知道活体解剖的好处。这里没有动物权利保护者！感谢科学！
让我印象深刻的是，他们仍然穿着实验室的外套，尽管它们被撕破了，匆忙地穿上，有一半不合身。作为他们文明的先锋，这些聪明的头脑当然仍然尊重过去的标志。
也许他们读过我的论文。
我知道你的愿望，尽管出于对约翰逊博士的尊重，你一直不愿表达，我也有同感。但我觉得，他是一个古老时代的遗物，我们应该用新的眼光去拥抱这个新世界。因此，我非常不情愿地建议自己担任巨蛋的新主管。我们可以把这里从我们的坟墓变成新文明的灯塔，和我们一起站在浪潮的顶点！
- 萨万特博士

ESP.ORIGINAL: SAVANT LOG 2
ESP.TRADUIT: 萨万特日志 2

ESP.ORIGINAL:
For those of you, that read the first report, and let's face it, though you won't admit, I can't see why you would have not. I would like to apologise profusely. It was a ruse! A ruse so I can make some effort to finding out the spy amongst us! It is a grave tragedy, that not only have the raiders occupied the city level, but more of the microbes of the Seltsam Syndrome has escaped the Dome and began infecting the environment outside.
Now, I know a lot of you may think I was fooled by these raiders. That Dr. King, you had the absurd notion that I was blinded by my jealousy of Dr. Johnson, that I would have done anything- and I could not clearly see this was a band of ruthless, post-apocalyptic killers. But I'm afraid, the real trick was played on the rest of you.
Any one of you would have any reason to let the raiders in- Perhaps to work with them, but it didn't take long for me to work out that there is no dealing with these people. Why, clearly, I knew that at the start. But perhaps, to escape? I know alot of you had pin-ups of Dr. Johnson, on your wall, that you stared at longingly, while I worked twice as hard as the rest of you to be here, but we are no longer in a time for heroes. I have every reason to believe Dr. Johnson let the raiders in!
Why not? Do we ever see him? He is always in the depths of the Dome. He came out of deep sleep before us? Is it possible, he has been communicating with these scum, all to engineer his escape and absolve himself of any guilt of endangering great, sharper minds than his?
Dr. Savant
ESP.TRADUIT:
对于那些读过第一份报告的人（让我们面对现实吧，虽然你不承认，但我看不出你为什么不承认），我想向你们深深道歉。那是一个诡计！一个诡计，以便我可以做一些事情。一个诡计，这样我就可以做出一些努力，找出我们中间的间谍！这是一个严重的悲剧，不仅掠夺者已经占领了城市层面，而且更多的泽尔特扎姆综合症微生物已经逃出了巨蛋，开始感染外面的环境。
现在，我知道你们很多人可能认为我被这些掠夺者愚弄了。金博士，你有一个荒谬的想法，认为我被对约翰逊博士的嫉妒蒙蔽了双眼，认为我什么都干得出来...我不能清楚地看到这是一伙无情的、后世界末日的杀手。但我担心真正的把戏是在你们其他人身上上演的。
你们中的任何一个人都有任何理由让掠夺者进入...也许是与他们合作，但没过多久我就明白了跟这些人是没法打交道的。为什么，很明显，我一开始就知道。但也许，是为了逃避？我知道你们中有几个人的墙上挂着约翰逊博士的海报，渴望地盯着看，而我比你们其他人付出了两倍的努力才来到这里！但我们已经不是英雄的时代了，我完全有理由相信是约翰逊博士让掠夺者进来的！
为什么不是？我们见过他吗？他总是在巨蛋的深处，他比我们先从沉睡中醒来！有没有可能他一直在和这些人渣来往，就是为了让他逃脱，从而使自己免除任何危害比他更大、更敏锐的头脑的罪责？
- 萨万特博士

ESP.ORIGINAL: SAVANT LOG 3
ESP.TRADUIT: 萨万特日志 3

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I like to retract my statement blaming Dr. Johnson for letting the raiders in. Perhaps I was a little rash in pointing fingers. When we blame each other like that, we only make ourselves weaker for the troubles ahead. Whatever those troubles may be.
I also like to say I will stop trying to advance myself as our new leader. Dr. Johnson led us before the war, and he will lead us in this time as well. Like all of you, I have a lot to thank him for. He brought me to the Dome when no university, company or government institution would touch me.
It's time to let go of the politics of the past. Stop trying to be something we are not, and be what we were born to be. Problem solvers. Let's solve this problem in our city sector. If we can't solve it. Perhaps it will come to us.
Dr. Savant
ESP.TRADUIT:
我想收回之前指责约翰逊博士让掠夺者进来的说法。也许我指责别人的时候有点鲁莽，当我们这样互相指责时，我们只会让自己在未来的麻烦面前变得更软弱，不管那些麻烦是什么。
我还想说，我将不再试图把自己晋升为我们的新领导人。约翰逊博士在战前领导过我们，现在他也会领导我们。像你们所有人一样，我有很多事情要感谢他，在没有大学、公司或政府机构愿意接触我的时候，他把我带到了巨蛋。
是时候放下过去的政治了，不要试图成为我们本来不是的样子，做我们与生俱来的样子:解决问题的人。让我们在城市部门解决这个问题，如果我们不能解决它，也许解决办法会自己来找我们。
- 萨万特博士

ESP.ORIGINAL: Boulder Recon Information
ESP.TRADUIT: 博尔德侦察情报

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Data recieved via the "Remote Ferals" within Boulder are limited, to say the least. However, I have managed to gather some data on the environmental state. The levels of radiation are higher than I'd previously calculated, though the intensity seems to spike and dip in various places, which suggests travel without an Environmental Suit is possible in theory. Of course, practically speaking, it is certain death! Even the mutated human beings would find themselves going feral before too long.
As I said, as data is limited, there is not much left to say. This is due to the strange interference we're getting, when communicating long-range to the Ferals. After an unpredictable amount of time, our transmissions are cut, with no prior warning. The others theorize that the unknown chemical properties of the radiation are causing this, but no supporting data has been revealed to support this, so I must hold the position of simply not knowing!
ESP.TRADUIT:
至少可以这样说，通过博尔德的“遥控野性尸鬼”接收到的数据是有限的。然而，我设法收集了一些关于环境状况的数据，辐射水平比我之前计算的要高，但强度似乎在不同的地方有升有降，这意味着理论上不穿环境防护服旅行是可能的。当然，实际上，这必死无疑！即使是变异的人类也会发现自己很快就会野化。
正如我所说的，由于数据有限，没有太多可说的，这是因为我们在与野性尸鬼进行远距离交流时受到了奇怪的干扰。在一段不可预测的时间后，我们的传输被切断，没有任何事先警告。其他人的理论认为是辐射的未知化学性质导致了这一现象，但没有任何数据支持这一理论，所以我必须持完全不知道的立场！

ESP.ORIGINAL: Environmental Armor
ESP.TRADUIT: 环境装甲

ESP.ORIGINAL:
In our study of the environmental state of Boulder, we had our first "Remote Feral" venture the outer crust of its radiation. The samples brought back contained extremely toxic, unknown chemical compounds, which seem to be the remnants of some prewar weapon of incredible scale, presumably Chinese in origin. While I could not gain a sufficient insight into the chemical properties themselves, I was able to thoroughly test their reactions to various materials. This was essential to devising my new prototype Environmental Armor.
I'm now 95 percent certain it will protect its wearer inside Boulder. This is however based on the assumption that the chemical properties in the outer crust of Boulder are identical to those at its center.
ESP.TRADUIT:
在我们对博尔德环境状况的研究中，我们第一次进行了“遥控野性尸鬼”的探险，探索其辐射的地层外壳。带回的样本中含有剧毒的未知化合物，似乎是某种战前规模惊人的武器的残留物，可能源自中国。虽然我不能充分了解它们的化学性质本身，但我能够彻底测试它们对各种材料的反应，这对于设计我的新型环境装甲原型至关重要。
我现在有95%的把握它能在博尔德保护穿戴者。然而，这是基于这样一个假设：博尔德地壳外层的化学性质与地壳中心的化学性质相同。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Ghoul Soldiers?
ESP.TRADUIT: 尸鬼士兵？

ESP.ORIGINAL: The Remote Ferals have transmitted some unusal data. Two of them were shot down by soldiers in Boulder, wearing armor similar to that of the NCR. One of the soldiers was unmasked and revealed to be a rational Ghoul. These soldiers seem to be a threatening force within Boulder. I shall inform Sentinel Grant immediately, so he is aware of any potential security risks of entering Boulder.
ESP.TRADUIT: 遥控野性尸鬼传输了一些不寻常的数据。他们中的两个被博尔德的士兵击落，他们穿着与NCR类似的盔甲，其中一个士兵被揭开面具，发现是一个理智尸鬼。这些士兵似乎是博尔德内部的一支威胁力量。我将立即通知尖兵格兰特，让他了解进入博尔德的任何潜在安全风险。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Unusual Sighting.
ESP.TRADUIT: 不寻常的发现。

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've recieved 2 seperate reports of a strange Mutant Cat wandering in the landfill. It's reported to be less aggressive and more intelligent than the others of its species we've encountered. Almost domestic.
ESP.TRADUIT: 我收到了两份不同的报告说有一只奇怪的变异猫在垃圾填埋场游荡。据报道，与我们遇到的其他同类相比，它没有那么强的攻击性，而且更聪明，几乎是家养的。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Military Threat in Boulder
ESP.TRADUIT: 博尔德的军事威胁

ESP.ORIGINAL: Doctor Field has reported military activity within Boulder. They're reported to be Ghouls wearing attire similar to that of the NCR. We did not expect the NCR could already be inside Boulder. They must have gone to extreme measures to overtake our own progress. The fact they are ghouls may mean the NCR has begun recruiting ghoul soldiers, who can better withstand the radiation inside Boulder. However, this would mean they'd be relying on a bunch of new recruits. There is something not quite right about the whole matter.
ESP.TRADUIT: 菲尔德博士报告了博尔德的军事活动，据报告，他们是穿着类似于NCR服装的食尸鬼。我们没想到NCR已经进入了博尔德，他们一定采取了极端措施来赶超我们的进度。他们是食尸鬼的事实可能意味着NCR已经开始招募食尸鬼士兵，他们可以更好地抵御博尔德内部的辐射。然而，这意味着他们将依赖于一群新成员。整个事情有些地方不太对。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Suspect in Custody
ESP.TRADUIT: 嫌疑人已被拘留

ESP.ORIGINAL: Following the untimely death of Inititate Robbins, I've taken a suspect, Edison Blake, into custody. I've closed off the site of the crime, which unfortunately is our only bathroom. Naturally, I've recieved a lot of complaints and handed out a lot of buckets. Looks like my "time off" is out of the question.
ESP.TRADUIT: 在新兵罗宾斯英年早逝之后，我拘留了一名嫌疑人，爱迪生·布莱克。我已经封锁了犯罪现场，很不幸，那是我们唯一的洗手间。当然，我收到了很多投诉，也受到了很多批评。看来我的"休假"是不可能了。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Cryo-chamber Cargo Report
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷冻室货物报告

ESP.ORIGINAL: We found Mickey's truck by the gas station, damaged beyond repair it seems. Mickey was missing, along with the human female that Fabler mentioned in his letter. I'm not so concerned about her. I don't really comprehend why Fabler even delivered her, when apparently all the information we need is within the cure formula notes, which themselves were missing from the wreckage. Not forgetting the courier, the first successful test subject, whose presence alone plays a vital role in persuading the Dome scientists of our cure's authenticity.
ESP.TRADUIT: 我们在加油站找到了米奇的卡车，似乎已经损坏无法修理了。米奇失踪了，还有法布勒在信中提到的那个人类女性。我不太关心她，我真不明白法布勒为什么要把她送来，我们需要的所有信息都在治疗配方的笔记里，而这些笔记却从残骸中丢失了。别忘了邮差，第一个成功的实验对象，他的存在本身就对说服巨蛋科学家相信治愈方法的真实性起至关重要的作用。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Scientist Outreach
ESP.TRADUIT: 科学家外联

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Our Scientist Outreach Program is proving to be more of a security risk with each passing day. There is a reason why the Brotherhood is generally very exclusive. Despite their renowned skills, the fact of the matter is the displine and loyalty of these scientists is entirely unknown to us. We are potentially approaching a time of war with the NCR, and we can't afford to be sending out troops as far as the Mojave. I will however accept Elder Guile's wishes, as his higher understanding is perhaps understandably confusing to one such as myself. For the Brotherhood!
Thankfully, with Mickey and Stu's unusual gasoline-powered trucks, those journeys are much less of a nightmare than originally anticipated. Another bonus of loosening our policies of exclusivity.
We've recently made contact with the infamous Doctor Fabler, operating outside Vegas. He is a very untrustworthy man, but I'm told he is a scientific genius, so we can't afford to refuse his help.
ESP.TRADUIT:
事实证明，我们的科学家拓展计划每天都在带来更多的安全风险，兄弟会通常非常排外是有原因的。尽管他们的技术闻名于世，但事实是，我们完全不知道这些科学家的纪律和忠诚。我们可能要和NCR开战了，我们不能把军队派到莫哈韦那么远。不过，我会接受盖尔长老的意愿，因为他的高深理解可能会让我这样的人感到困惑。为了兄弟会！
幸运的是，有了米奇和斯图不寻常的汽油动力卡车，这些旅程比最初预期的要轻松得多。放宽排他政策的另一个好处。
我们最近联系上了臭名昭著的法布勒博士，他在维加斯外活动。他是一个非常不值得信赖的人，但我听说他是一个科学天才，所以我们不能拒绝他的帮助。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Order of Non-Contact
ESP.TRADUIT: 无接触指令

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Elder Guile has declared an order of non-contact with the Mojave chapter, applicable to those attending the meeting with Doctor Fabler, outside Vegas. I don't think it will be an issue, due to heavy NCR presence they'll likely have been forced into hiding, if they're still alive at all.
The order does raise some questions for myself. Is Elder Guile still in contact with the rest of the Brotherhood? Are we now officially a fractured branch? I do wonder, though my place is not to question. Elder Guile is a great leader and a great man. He has enough on his mind without inane accusations of my own.
ESP.TRADUIT:
盖尔长老已宣布禁止与莫哈韦分会接触，适用于在维加斯城外参加法布勒博士会面的人。我不认为这是一个问题，由于大量NCR的存在，他们可能被迫躲藏起来，如果他们还活着的话。
这个命令确实给我带来了一些问题。盖尔长老还和其他兄弟会成员有联系吗？我们现在正式成为一个分裂的分会了吗？我很好奇，不过我不该质疑，盖尔长老是一个伟大的领袖，一个伟大的人。他要操心的事已经够多的了，我也不会再做无谓的指责了。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Lost Journal 5 of 5
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面遗失的日记(第5页，共5页)

ESP.ORIGINAL:
9/2165
Georgia died too, but at least I’m moving up in the world! At last! My very own mailbox! The thought of potentially receiving an actual letter someday fills me with giddiness!
2167
I forgot to get up.
I lay in bed for so long, Dr. Hart says I nearly drowned in my own saliva. Now, Gigi and Andre have instituted mandatory parties, AKA “Deadpan’s Rule.” Huzzah. I am now immortal.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2165年9月
乔治亚也死了，但至少我在世界范围内的地位提高了！终于！我自己的邮箱！一想到有一天可能会收到一封真正的信，我就觉得很兴奋！
2167年
我忘了起床。
我躺在床上太久了，哈特医生说我差点被自己的唾液淹死。现在，琪琪和安德烈设立了强制协议，又叫“冷面”规则。我现在是不朽的了。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Lost Journal 1 of 5
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面遗失的日记(第1页，共5页)

ESP.ORIGINAL:
This journal is cursed! If you read it you will DIE!!! of boredom.
Y2 Summer?
It’s official. We’re all gonna die here. All hope of going home was shit down the cliff by that asshole cop who think’s he own’s us. He’s got these morons actually building houses in here! You can’t just paint a prison and expect people to call it home!
Keep waking up with leg pains even if I lie down all day. Been this way for a month. Dr. Hart says, I’m growing, but what the hell does, a dentist know anyway? Gigi read me a book-- did voices and every thing. Ever here an old lady do a pirate? Gram never read me books. We watched tv. I miss Gram. And Lenore.
Dreamed about pizza again. I wish I was dead.
ESP.TRADUIT:
这本日记被诅咒了！如果你读了它，你就会死！！无聊。
Y2夏天?
这是官方消息。我们都会死在这里，回家的唯一希望被那个自以为拥有我们的混蛋警察扔下了悬崖。他让这些白痴在这里盖房子！你不能只是粉刷了一座监狱就指望人们把它叫做家！
即使我躺了一整天，醒来时腿还是疼。这样已经一个月了，哈特医生说我长高了，但一个牙医到底懂什么？琪琪给我读了一本书，做了配音和一切。你听过一个老太太演海盗吗？奶奶从来不给我读书。我们看了电视，我想念奶奶，还有丽诺儿。
又梦到披萨了。我希望我已经死了。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Play Draft
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面的扮演草案

ESP.ORIGINAL:
“Mr. Whiskers' Final Debate,” scene III draft:
Scar Pei aims his trusty Bulldog revolver at President Whiskers’ head, but Whiskers counters with a laser pistol.
Whiskers: Scar Pei! How dare you show your muzzle around here after nine cat-sassination attempts, among other crimes. Bark now before I shoot!
*Note to self: Find out if Petey burned his costume. If so, beat him.
Scar Pei: Fool! Dinosaurs cannot fly, and pterodactyls are not dinosaurs!
*Idea: Scar Pei is too obvious a culprit. Consider replacing him with time-travelling John Milks Mewth. May have to play myself. Gather courage to ask &PCName; for opinion.
ESP.TRADUIT:
胡须先生的最后辩论，第三幕草稿:
刀疤佩把他可靠的斗牛犬左轮手枪对准了胡须总统的头，但胡须用激光手枪反击。
胡须：刀疤佩！你怎么敢在你九次试图刺杀猫，还犯下了其他罪行之后在这里亮出你的枪口。在我开枪之前快叫！
*提醒自己：看看珀泰是否烧了他的服装。如果是，那就揍他。
刀疤佩：傻瓜！恐龙不会飞，而且翼手龙也不是恐龙！
*想法：刀疤佩是罪魁祸首的话太明显了。考虑用穿越时空的约翰·米尔克斯·梅斯取代他。我可能要扮演我自己，鼓起勇气问&PCName;的意见。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Lost Journal 2 of 5
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面遗失的日记(第2页，共5页)

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Jan. 1X, 28
Big day! I hung up the cane!
Finally said screw it and tied a can to my shoe. My leg still hurts, so it’s likely still growing. I could almost hear the snickers, strutting by with my perfectly even pant cuffs, but they can all kiss my ass! Tonight I’m asking Gigi to clear some space on the wall cause I’m hanging up that rotten chunk of bamboo for good!
Does this mean I’ll get put to work on that ridiculous stage thing?
ESP.TRADUIT:
28年1月1?日
大日子！我把拐杖挂起来了！
最后说去他的，然后在我的鞋上绑了个罐头。我的腿还在疼，所以可能还在长。我几乎能听到窃笑的声音，我的裤子袖口完全一样，昂首阔步走过，但他们都去亲我的屁股吧！今晚我要让琪琪在墙上腾出点地方来，因为我要把那根烂竹子永远挂起来！
这是不是意味着我会被安排去演那个可笑的舞台剧？

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Lost Journal 3 of 5
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面遗失的日记(第3页，共5页)

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2051
Found a maggot sleeping in my leg. I named him Frankie. I was surprised that he had no friends. Had to admire the little fellow’s perseverance in making it this far, before I passed out. That’ll be the last time I venture outside in anything less than knee socks and a three-piece suit!
Still 2051
Oh god!!! His extended family has come to visit!! HELP!!
Yet More 2051
Today I made the mistake of sneezing. How much would I get for putting half a nose beneath the wadded up t-shirt I call a pillow?
Sick of 2051 yet?
Still sick. My nose is gone but still runs! Oh, why?!
ESP.TRADUIT:
2051年
发现一条蛆睡在我腿上，我给它起名叫弗兰基，我很惊讶他没有朋友。我不得不佩服这个小家伙的毅力，在我昏倒之前，他能走这么远。这将是我最后一次穿着及膝袜和三件套以外的衣服出门！
还是2051年
噢，上帝！！他的大家族来拜访了！！救命啊！！
又是2051年
今天我犯了一个错误，打喷嚏。如果我把半个鼻子埋在我称之为枕头的卷起来的t恤下面能得到多少钱？
厌倦2051年了吗？
病还没好。我的鼻子没了，但还在流鼻涕！噢，为什么？！

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Lost Journal 4 of 5
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面遗失的日记(第4页，共5页)

ESP.ORIGINAL:
06/2165
Triple digits. Hooray for me. I’m only aware of it because Jackie snapped a conical hat onto my head and attempted to fasten a cardboard “1” to the right side of my glasses.
Our visitor, Miss Thunder-skull (less than half my age, yet burned as badly), made a great fuss about it, but I feel the same: aggressively apathetic and vaguely tired. I cannot remember anything from the past week? Month? Yet I recall Lenore’s red, heart-shaped rabies tag, and the year prior, she’d worn a blue flower. Don’t know how anyone else made it this far. We just drift as always. Nothing more.
In the absence of cupcakes, Gigi baked me a meatloaf with ketchup frosting, but thanks to Charlie’s obsession with stocking surplus bear jerky, it was like gnawing on the blistered tongue of a shoe. I swore it bounced when I dropped it. At least I recall what I ate for breakfast all this time. Thank you, Charlie. Your mummified flesh strips are the only thing preventing my descent into senility. I think I’ll go back to sleep.
08/2165
Well, the bears finally got him. Who will win his house at the talent show?
ESP.TRADUIT:
2165年6月
三位数。为我欢呼。我之所以知道，是因为杰姬把一顶圆锥形的帽子扣在我头上，还试图用一块硬纸板固定？？在我眼镜的右边。
我们的客人，雷霆骷髅小姐(年龄不到我的一半，但烧伤得同样严重)对此大惊小怪，但我也有同样的感觉:极度冷漠，隐约感到疲倦。我记不起过去发生的任何事情，星期？月份？但我记得丽诺儿的红色心形狂犬病标签，前一年，她还戴了一朵蓝色的花。不知道其他人是怎么走到这一步的，我们就像往常一样随波逐流，仅此而已。
在没有纸杯蛋糕的情况下，琪琪给我烤了一个加了番茄酱糖霜的肉饼，但由于查理对囤积过剩熊肉干的痴迷，这就像在啃起泡的鞋舌，我发誓它掉在地上时弹了起来。至少我还记得我早餐吃了什么，谢谢你，查理，你那干瘪的肉条是唯一能阻止我衰老的东西。我想我要回去睡觉了。
2165年8月
好吧，熊终于抓住他了。谁会在才艺表演中赢得他的房子？

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Journal
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面的日记

ESP.ORIGINAL:
April ?, 2278
Dearest Lenore,
Our Gigi has discovered another egg with two yolks. She paraded it through town square in a frying pan throne. While it was a jovial occasion for everyone, all I saw upon beholding it were your glistening eyes, so large...so trusting. When she fried them, I had to run home, as I could not bear the hissing sound.
I still miss you, Herve
ESP.TRADUIT:
2278年6月？日
亲爱的丽诺儿
我们的琪琪又发现了一个有两个蛋黄的鸡蛋，她把它放在一个煎锅宝座上，在城市广场上游行。虽然这对每个人来说都是一个愉快的时刻，但我一看到它，仿佛就看到了你那双闪闪发光的大眼睛...如此值得信任。当她煎蛋的时候，我不得不跑回家，因为我无法忍受嘶嘶的声音。
我依然想念你， - 赫尔夫

ESP.ORIGINAL: Deadpan's Pencils
ESP.TRADUIT: 冷面的铅笔

ESP.ORIGINAL: A tall ghoul named "Deadpan" wants ten pencils. He lives in Boulder and wears a straw hat and glasses.
ESP.TRADUIT: 一个叫"冷面"的高个子食尸鬼想要十支铅笔。他住在博尔德，戴着草帽和眼镜。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Cleaning Your Skimmer Hat
ESP.TRADUIT: 清洁你的遮阳帽

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To clean my hat, you'll need the following supplies:
1 Purified water 1 Box of detergent 1 Big Pot 1 Soft cloth (if you're in a pinch, a dead dog could work!)
You'll need to warm the water over a fire before gently wiping the straw.
ESP.TRADUIT:
要清洁我的帽子，你需要以下用品:
- 一瓶纯净水 - 一盒洗涤剂 - 一个锅子 - 一块软布（如果你在紧要关头，一条死狗也可以！）
你需要在火上加热水，然后轻轻地擦拭吸管。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Gremlin Clues
ESP.TRADUIT: 小魔怪的线索

ESP.ORIGINAL: The gremlin’s next target is the projector, and the time is between two and four in the morning.
ESP.TRADUIT: 小魔怪的下一个目标是投影仪，时间是凌晨两点到四点之间。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Anti-Abomination Training Supplies
ESP.TRADUIT: 克制可憎生物训练用品

ESP.ORIGINAL:
These items are required to train Lenore in fighting "abominations" such as nightstalkers, mutant cannibals and deathclaws:
- Centaur blood - Deathclaw hand - Deathclaw egg - Nightstalker blood - Nightstalker tail - Nightstalker egg - Raw cannibal meat
ESP.TRADUIT:
这些物品是训练莲娜对抗“可憎生物”，如夜魇兽，变种食人族和死亡爪所必需的:
- 多脚兽的血 - 死亡爪的爪子 - 死亡爪蛋 - 夜魇兽的血 - 夜魇兽尾巴 - 夜魇兽的蛋 - 生食人族肉

ESP.ORIGINAL: Anti-Humanoid Training Supplies
ESP.TRADUIT: 克制人类训练用品

ESP.ORIGINAL:
These items are required to train Lenore in fighting humans, ghouls (feral or not), and super mutants. This does not include mutant cannibals or spore carriers, which are classified as “abominations.”
- 5 Human Flesh - Minigun - Bumper Sword - Stealth Boy
ESP.TRADUIT:
这些道具是训练丽诺儿对抗人类，食尸鬼(野性或非野性)和超级变种人所必需的。这不包括变种食人族或孢子携带者，它们被归类为可憎生物。
- 5个人肉 - 转轮机枪 - 保险杠巨剑 - 隐身小子

ESP.ORIGINAL: Anti-Arthopod Training Supplies
ESP.TRADUIT: 克制节肢动物训练用品

ESP.ORIGINAL:
These items are required to train Lenore in fighting arthropods:
-Bloatfly meat -Cazador egg -Fire ant meat -Fire ant egg -Albino ant meat -Albino ant egg -Ant meat -Ant egg -Mantis foreleg -Mantis egg -Radroach meat
ESP.TRADUIT:
训练丽诺儿对抗节肢动物需要这些物品:
- 辐射蝇肉 - 猎蜂蛋 - 火蚁肉 - 火蚁蛋 - 白化蚂蚁卵 - 白化蚂蚁肉 - 蚂蚁肉 - 蚂蚁蛋 - 螳螂前腿 - 巨型螳螂蛋 - 辐射蟑螂肉

ESP.ORIGINAL: Anti-Animal Training Supplies
ESP.TRADUIT: 克制动物训练用品

ESP.ORIGINAL:
These items are required to train Lenore in fighting mutant and normal animals. This does not include deathclaws and nightstalkers, which are classified as “abominations.”
- Bighorner meat - Brahmin meat - Coyote meat - Dog meat - Gecko meat - Gecko egg - Giant Rat Meat - Mole rat meat - Lakelurk meat - Lakelurk Egg
ESP.TRADUIT:
这些物品是用来训练丽诺儿对抗变种人和正常动物的。这不包括死亡爪和夜魇兽，它们被归类为可憎生物。
- 大角羊肉 - 婆罗门肉 - 郊狼肉 - 狗肉 - 蜥蜴肉 - 蜥蜴蛋 - 巨鼠肉 - 鼹鼠肉 - 湖沼蟹肉 - 湖沼蟹蛋

ESP.ORIGINAL: Dr. Clementine Shirker's Log 1
ESP.TRADUIT: 克莱芒蒂娜·舍克博士的日志 1

ESP.ORIGINAL: I’ve seen “Mr. Red” and “Mr. Green” scavenging in the area again. It’s hard to see them from the Dome, since they never approach (I wonder why). At first, they appear to be suffering from the syndrome like us, but they’re too strong and active (also, not dead). They’ve been coming around at least since my revival from stasis. They tend to carry much more than they could consume and at such regularity, I’m confident that they belong to a larger group.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我看见了，红先生？和绿先生？又在这个区域拾荒了。从巨蛋上很难看到他们，因为他们从不靠近(我想知道为什么)。起初，他们看起来像我们一样患有这种综合症，但他们太强壮、太活跃了(也没有死亡)。
至少在我从停滞期苏醒后他们就开始出现了。他们携带的东西往往超过了他们的消耗能力，在这种情况下，我相信他们属于一个更大的群体。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Sentinel Grant's Report
ESP.TRADUIT: 尖兵格兰特的报告

ESP.ORIGINAL:
10.05.81 - 6:05 PM
Fairly uneventful morning followed by a new development. Our issue with the giant ant colony was resolved by some kind of spotted cat, which was much too small to be a typical wildcat, but had too long of a tail to be a bobcat.
Possible mutant or new species? May be suffering from burns or unknown parasitic infection. Exercise caution if it approaches. After neutralizing much of the colony, it took off towards the landfill. Better keep an eye out.
ESP.TRADUIT:
81年10月5日 - 下午6点05
一个波澜不惊的早晨，随后又有了新的进展。我们与巨蚁群的问题被某种斑点猫解决了，这种猫太小了，不可能是典型的野猫，但尾巴太长，不可能是山猫。
可能的突变体还是新的物种？可能患有烧伤或未知寄生虫感染。如果它接近，要小心。在消灭了大部分蚁群后，它向垃圾填埋场飞去。最好留心点。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Pvt. Fingers' Incentive Chart
ESP.TRADUIT: 列兵芬格尔的奖励图表

ESP.ORIGINAL:
The zombie apocalypse has begun! I want YOU to bring me their cold, dead fingers!
1 finger = 5 caps 5 fingers = stimpak 10 fingers = 5.56 ammo 15 fingers = hydra 25 fingers = service rifle 50 fingers = mystery prize!!
Thanks for playing!
ESP.TRADUIT:
僵尸末日已经到来了！ 我要你把他们冰冷、僵硬的手指带给我！
1根手指 = 5瓶盖 5根手指 = 治疗针 10根手指 = 5.56子弹 15根手指 = 许德拉药水 25根手指 = 服务步枪 50根手指 = 神秘大奖！！
感谢游玩！

ESP.ORIGINAL: Dr. Clementine Shirker's Log 2
ESP.TRADUIT: 克莱芒蒂娜·舍克博士的日志 2

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I thought they were absolutely insane at first, insisting that they’d survived the nuclear bombardment-- the one 200 years ago! It was simply impossible, until I recognized him: Jeff. Oh, my god, Jeff! What the hell happened to you? Having your experimental biofuel turn into a snack is no reason to condemn such a brilliant man to this pit! I’m also pretty sure I saw Commissioner Sinclair. The bastard got what he deserved...if that *is* him.
It may’ve been the stupidest thing I’d ever done, but when I saw those fake doctors storm their way into the Dome and start massacring people, I bolted out the door during the chaos before it could seal shut. Considering the mutations that have ravaged local wildlife, Mr. Green and Mr. Red’s friends couldn’t have survived for this long without good firepower. The radiation almost got me (the suit helped a little), but when I found their cave, the people were nice enough to take care of me.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我起初觉得他们绝对是疯了，坚持认为他们在200年前的核轰炸中幸存了下来！这简直是不可能的，直到我认出了他:杰夫。我的天啊，杰夫！你到底发生了什么？你的实验性生物燃料变成了零食，这不是让一个如此聪明的人陷入这个深渊的理由！我也很确定我见到了辛克莱局长，那混蛋罪有应得...如果那*是*他的话。
这可能是我做过的最愚蠢的事，但当我看到那些假医生冲进巨蛋开始屠杀人们时，我趁着混乱在巨蛋还没封上之前就冲出了大门。考虑到当地野生动物的基因突变，如果没有强大的火力，绿先生和红先生的朋友不可能活这么久。
辐射差点让我丧命(防护服起了点作用)，但当我找到他们的洞穴时，那里的人很好地照顾了我。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Dr. Clementine Shirker's Log 3
ESP.TRADUIT: 克莱芒蒂娜·舍克博士的日志 3

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Found out why the townspeople never visit the Dome. Their leader refused to help me fight back the invaders, even when Jeff and that Sinclair kid tried to bargain with him. Apparently, when the ground shifted, one of our access tunnels ruptured, creating a link to this cave. They knocked on the door for months, but no one came to save them. If the lockdown hadn’t been so sudden, we could’ve accommodated every one of them.
If they don’t want to fight, fine! But I can’t leave Ingrid and Tora up there any longer. I have to get them down here…
ESP.TRADUIT:
我知道为什么镇上的人从不去巨蛋了。他们的首领拒绝帮助我反击入侵者，即使杰夫和那个叫辛克莱的孩子试图和他讨价还价。显然，当地面移动时，我们的一条通道破裂了，形成了一条通往这个洞穴的通道。他们敲了几个月的门，但没有人来救他们。如果封锁不是这么突然的话，我们可以把所有人都安排进去。
如果他们不想打架，没问题！但我不能再把英格丽德和托拉留在那里了。我得把他们叫过来吗？

ESP.ORIGINAL: Strange Disease
ESP.TRADUIT: 怪病

ESP.ORIGINAL:
As it seems our days our numbered if we don't find a cure, I've decided to keep a record of our experience of the strange disease we're calling the Seltsam Syndrome.
It is certain we caught the virus prior to entering cryostasis, for not long after awakening we began to show unusual symptoms. Starting with intense over-tiredness and decreased motor skills. We then began to experience severe skin irritation and scabbing. We had to wear gloves to prevent ourselves from scratching.
Our flesh was degrading at an alarming rate, which prompted much-needed modifications to our Dome suits, so we were able to both contain the virus and slow the rate of its progression within our bodies. Over time, our skin has begun to droop like melting clay. We've become like zombies, rotting while still alive.
The cryo-infusion technology developed by Doctor Galton is the only thing keeping our insides from rotting into an unusable state. I've never seen anything like this virus.
ESP.TRADUIT:
如果我们找不到治愈方法，我们的日子就不多了，我决定记录下我们经历的一种奇怪的疾病，我们称之为泽尔特扎姆综合征。
可以肯定的是，我们在进入冷冻状态之前就感染了病毒，因为在苏醒后不久，我们就开始表现出不寻常的症状，先是强烈的过度疲劳和运动能力下降。然后我们开始经历严重的皮肤过敏和结痂，我们必须戴上手套以防抓伤。
我们的肉体正在以惊人的速度退化，这促使我们急需对巨蛋防护服进行改造，这样我们既能控制病毒又能减缓病毒在我们体内的扩散速度。随着时间的推移，我们的皮肤开始下垂，就像融化的粘土。我们变得像僵尸一样，还活着就开始腐烂。
高尔顿博士开发的冷冻输注是唯一能防止我们的内脏腐烂到无法使用状态的技术。我从没见过这种病毒

ESP.ORIGINAL: In The Clear
ESP.TRADUIT: 不受阻碍

ESP.ORIGINAL: There's been no Legion sightings since the scouts we monitored six months ago. It looks like the Legion have overlooked Boulder for now. Too spicey for them, as Mickey would say. I wish I could say the same about Denver. Who knows what old world technology could be buried in that city, if we could only get in to salvage it.
ESP.TRADUIT: 从我们六个月前监视的侦察兵开始就没有军团的踪迹了。看来军团暂时忽略了博尔德，就像米奇说的，对他们来说太烂了。我希望我也能对丹佛说同样的话，谁知道那个城市里会埋着什么旧世界的科技，只要我们能进去把它抢救出来。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Update on Gas Locations
ESP.TRADUIT: 气油位置更新

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Stu, here's the directions you asked for. We're down to two gas stores now, since the Legion sniffed the other one out, near Denver.
In Nevada, you'll find the cave in the Nellis Airplane Graveyard, outside Vegas. When you hear a bunch of zombies speaking Chinese, you're in the right place buddy. You'll be able to fill up there, when you're driving back to Colorado.
Now, in Colorado, you'll find the second cave in the landfill at Boulder Mountain Park.
Be careful out there, Stu. Those Metalhead freaks are running wild lately. I've never seen them so worked up. They're not as stupid as they look. I get the feeling they're up to something big.
I'm making the journey back to Nevada now, to pick up a couple a cold coffins for the Brotherhood.
Mickey
ESP.TRADUIT:
斯图，这是你要的路线。我们现在只剩下两家加油站了，因为军团在丹佛附近找到了另一家。
在内华达州，你会在拉斯维加斯外的内利斯飞机墓地找到这个洞穴。当你听到一群僵尸说中文时，你就来对地方了，伙计。等你开车回到科罗拉多州时，你就可以在那里加满油。
现在，在科罗拉多州，你会在博尔德山公园的垃圾填埋场找到第二个山洞。
在外面要小心，斯图，那些金属头怪胎最近很猖狂，我从来没见过他们这么激动过。他们不像看起来那么蠢，我觉得他们有什么大阴谋。
我现在要回内华达去为兄弟会取几具冰冷的棺材。
- 米奇

ESP.ORIGINAL: Warning Note
ESP.TRADUIT: 警告说明

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Forget about this place Jill, it's infested, weird pale ants everywhere. They have these nest ball things that emit some kind of thick acidic gas. That stuff is vicious, eats right through you, it can tear you to pieces in seconds! Skin, clothes, armor, doesn't matter, dissolves it all.
I think they've got some kind of poison as well, one of the little buggers nipped me, I don't feel too good. I'll wait for you but I don't know if I can hold on till you get back. I'm sorry Jill.
-Rich
ESP.TRADUIT:
忘了这地方吧，吉尔，到处都是虫子，奇怪的苍白蚂蚁。它们的巢球状物质会释放出某种浓酸性气体，那东西很恶毒，能直接吞噬你，几秒钟就能把你撕成碎片！皮肤，衣服，盔甲，都无所谓，都能溶解。
我想它们也有某种毒素，其中一个小家伙咬了我一口，我感觉不太舒服。 我会等你的，但我不知道我是否能坚持到你回来。 我很抱歉，吉尔。
- 瑞奇
